title: Manmohan Singh - Wikipedia
snippet: Manmohan Singh (26 September 1932 – 26 December 2024) was an Indian economist and statesman who served as the prime minister of India from 2004 to 2014. He was the fourth longest-serving prime minister after Jawaharlal Nehru, Indira Gandhi, and Narendra Modi.

title: Dr. Manmohan Singh | Prime Minister of India
snippet: Singh served as a Member of India’s Upper House of Parliament (the Rajya Sabha) from 1991 and was the Leader of the Opposition between 1998 and 2004. He was sworn in as Prime Minister on 22nd May 2004, following the general elections, and took the oath of office for a second term on 22nd May 2009.

title: Manmohan Singh | Biography, Reforms, Political Career, & Death | Britannica
snippet: Manmohan Singh (1932–2024) was an Indian economist and politician who was the first person from a minority community to serve as prime minister of India (2004–14).
